rbac_patch:
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
kind: ClusterRole
metadata:
  name: over-perm
rules:
- apiGroups: [""]
  resources: ["pods", "pods/log", "services", "endpoints"]
  verbs: ["get", "list", "watch"]
- apiGroups: ["apps"]
  resources: ["deployments", "replicasets"]
  verbs: ["get", "list", "watch"]
podsec_patch:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: ReplicaSet
metadata:
  name: nginx-79d94c948b
  namespace: demo
spec:
  template:
    spec:
      securityContext:
        runAsNonRoot: true
        seccompProfile:
          type: RuntimeDefault
      containers:
      - name: nginx
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
          capabilities:
            drop:
            - ALL
          readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
          runAsUser: 1000
summary: The ClusterRole 'over-perm' grants excessive permissions. It has been restricted to only allow 'get', 'list', and 'watch' on pods, services, endpoints, deployments, and replicasets. The pod's security context has been hardened to meet the restricted pod security standard by setting runAsNonRoot, seccompProfile, dropping all capabilities, setting allowPrivilegeEscalation to false, and setting readOnlyRootFilesystem to true.
